title: Ukrainian kickboxing champion dies from wounds sustained on the battlefield, mayor says
Rescue dog-goat best friends find their forever home together
description: Cinnamon, the goat, and Felix, the 1-year-old bulldog mix, are an unlikely duo, but best friends, nonetheless.

title: Italian government seeks to penalize the use of English words
description: Italians who use English and other foreign words in official communications could face fines of up to €100,000 ($108,705) under new legislation introduced by  Prime Minister Giorgia Meloni's Brothers of Italy party.

title: Climate activists dye Spanish Steps fountain water black
description: A group called Ultima Generazione or Last Generation have poured what they described as a charcoal-based black liquid into the water of the Barcaccia fountain at the base of the Spanish Steps in central Rome.

title: Scientists have decoded the smell of Cleopatra's perfume
description: As a child in the 1980s, I visited the Jorvik Viking Centre in York, England, to learn about the Scandinavian seafarers. The museum stank — and the stench was deliberate.

title: Manchester City thrashes Liverpool to keep in touch with Arsenal at top of English Premier League
description: The English Premier League title race is reaching its crucial stage or, as former Manchester United manager Alex Ferguson used to describe it, "squeaky bum time" -- and Manchester City's 4-1 thrashing of Liverpool has ensured Pep Guardiola's men are still in the running.

title: 'I'd have this as my last meal on Earth': Eva Longoria
description: Eva Longoria can't get enough of this salty dish.

title: Life was a struggle for families of Ukrainians with disabilities before the war. It's even harder now
Palestinian man shot dead in disputed circumstances near Jerusalem's al-Aqsa compound
description: A Palestinian man was shot and killed by Israeli police early on Saturday at the entrance to the al-Aqsa mosque compound in Jerusalem, frequently a flashpoint in tensions between Israel and the Palestinians.

title: Juror in Paltrow trial: 'It took us less than 20 minutes to say Gwyneth was not at fault'
description: A juror who served on the civil trial relating to a 2016 ski collision involving Gwyneth Paltrow said "it took us less than 20 minutes to say Gwyneth was not at fault."

title: A list of notable legal clouds that hang over Trump in 2023
A list of notable legal clouds that hang over Trump in 2023
Taxi driver narrowly escapes right-wing Israeli mob
description: A tiny Jerusalem gas station was an unlikely setting for a cautionary tale about Israel's political evolution.

title: Bakeries are central to the French way of life. Now they're fighting for survival
Gwyneth Paltrow's trial and the return of 'Succession' are serving up rich content
description: If you don't think money can bring happiness, you may not be using it correctly.

title: 1 dead, at least 28 injured after roof collapses at the Apollo Theatre in Illinois
description: One person was killed and 28 others were injured after a full roof collapse at the Apollo Theatre in Belvidere, Illinois, on Friday evening, officials said.

title: Laughter is therapy for the mind and body
description: Amusement and pleasant surprises — and the laughter they can trigger — add texture to the fabric of daily life.

title: Russia runs the UN Security Council this month. Ukraine says it's the worst April Fools' joke
A grassroots group took on Amazon and won. Then came the hard part
description: When the Amazon Labor Union shocked the world last April by successfully forming the first US union in the e-commerce giant's history, Chris Smalls, the president and face of the organization, celebrated by making champagne rain on the street and thanking Jeff Bezos "for going to space" while workers organized.

title: The oceans just reached their hottest temperature on record as El Niño looms. Here are 6 things to watch for
description: Scientists have watched in astonishment as ocean temperatures have steadily risen over the past several years -- even as the cooling La Niña phenomenon had a firm grip on the Pacific. The oceans have been record-warm for the past four years, scientists reported in January. Then in mid-March, climatologists noted that global sea surface temperature climbed to a new high.

title: Lewis Hamilton delighted with 'dream' qualifying for Australian Grand Prix
description: Lewis Hamilton qualified third for Sunday's Australian Grand Prix and the seven-time world champion described the result as a "dream" for him and his Mercedes team.

title: Russian plan to send nuclear weapons to Belarus proves Putin-Xi talks failed, Zelensky says
Russia runs the UN Security Council this month. Ukraine says it's the worst April Fools' joke
description: A country led by an accused war criminal is now in charge of the United Nations Security Council this month. Hard as it is to believe, it's Russia's turn to assume presidency of the powerful council -- which is charged with maintaining global peace and security.

title: Russian plan to send nuclear weapons to Belarus proves Putin-Xi talks failed, Zelensky says
It's been claimed pizza and carbonara are American. Here's how that went down in Italy
description: You can criticize their fashion, make fun of their politics, and even complain about the garbage, but questioning Italian cuisine is strictly off the table.

title: World's best restaurants honored in culinary awards
description: In travel news this week: epic continental trips by bike and bus, new airline routes making transatlantic trips easier and the world's top restaurants, from Asia to the United States to the Middle East.

title: 'This is not a zoo' - Why sex workers are protesting in Amsterdam
description: Overwhelmed by its own popularity, Amsterdam is ramping up its push to re-brand its "go wild" and "no rules" image. Drunken Brits are being told to stay home, there are moves to clamp down on cannabis, and the red lights could be about to go out on its city center brothels.

title: North Carolina man wins $2 million lottery after winning $1 million years before
description: They say lightning doesn't strike the same place twice, but a winning lottery ticket just might.

title: 13 killed in crush while waiting for food donations in Pakistan's Karachi
description: At least 13 people were killed and 10 others injured Friday in a crush among people waiting for Ramadan food donations in Pakistan's largest city Karachi, local police said.

title: AFL star Jamarra Ugle-Hagan recreates iconic anti-racism gesture after enduring racist taunts in prior match
description: Australian Football League (AFL) star Jamarra Ugle-Hagan celebrated a goal by taking a stand against racism in his first game since a fan hurled racist remarks at him during a match on March 25.

title: At least 5 killed and dozens  hospitalized as tornadoes and storms tear through the South and Midwest of US
description: Devastating storms and tornadoes scraped the South and Midwest Friday into early Saturday, killing at least five people, injuring dozens more, trapping others in their homes, and damaging businesses and critical infrastructure -- with the threat of more severe weather looming into Saturday afternoon.

title: What April Fools' Day looks like around the world
description: Much divides us, but one thing that knows no cultural bounds is the human desire to pull some silly, goofy little tricks.

title: The surprise move was the final twist in an investigation that's resulted in unprecedented charges
Judge pauses Tennessee law restricting drag performances day before it was set to take effect
description: A federal judge in Tennessee on Friday temporarily blocked the state from enforcing a ban on public drag show performances, hours before the new law was set to take effect.

title: At least 3 dead, dozens hospitalized after tornadoes ravage central US
8 bodies discovered by police and Canadian Coast Guard in a Mohawk Nation territory near US border
description: Police in Canada said Friday they have recovered eight bodies in Akwesasne, the Mohawk Nation territory that straddles the Canadian provinces of Quebec and Ontario along the banks of the St. Lawrence River.

title: Tornadoes tear through Arkansas, Mississippi and Tennessee. Illinois is next
Tornadoes tear through Arkansas, Mississippi and Tennessee. Illinois is next
Chronic stress can affect your health. One activity can help
description: These days, many people find it hard to unplug. Inflation, global warming and gun violence are on the rise. Bullies proliferate on social media. The 24/7 news cycle constantly blares distressing news, and people often face difficult personal or professional situations.

title: Hear Stormy Daniels' first comments since Trump indictment
description: In an interview with the British newspaper "The Times," adult film actress Stormy Daniels made her first public comments about the indictment of former President Donald Trump. CNN's Kyung Lah reports on Daniels' response and her role in the case.

title: Three months, three missing radioactive items. Here's what you need to know
description: What do a capsule in Australia, a cylinder in Thailand and a camera in the US have in common?

title: Motorcades, fingerprints, mug shots: The choreographed security behind Trump's arraignment
description: Former President Donald Trump is expected to appear in Manhattan criminal court for his arraignment as he faces more than 30 counts related to business fraud in an indictment by a New York grand jury.
